verses.verse: Oh <WH3863> that thou wouldest rend <WH7167> the heavens <WH8064>, that thou wouldest come down <WH3381>, that the mountains <WH2022> might flow down <WH2151> at thy presence <WH6440>,

As when the melting <WH2003> fire <WH784> burneth <WH6919>, the fire <WH784> causeth the waters <WH4325> to boil <WH1158>, to make thy name <WH8034> known <WH3045> to thine adversaries <WH6862>, that the nations <WH1471> may tremble <WH7264> at thy presence <WH6440>! the melting: Heb. the fire of meltings
When thou didst <WH6213> terrible things <WH3372> which we looked <WH6960> not for, thou camest down <WH3381>, the mountains <WH2022> flowed down <WH2151> at thy presence <WH6440>.

For since the beginning of the world <WH5769> men have not heard <WH8085>, nor perceived by the ear <WH238>, neither hath the eye <WH5869> seen <WH7200>, O God <WH430>, beside <WH2108> thee, what he hath prepared <WH6213> for him that waiteth <WH2442> for him. seen: or, seen a God beside thee, which doeth so for him, etc

Thou meetest <WH6293> him that rejoiceth <WH7797> and worketh <WH6213> righteousness <WH6664>, those that remember <WH2142> thee in thy ways <WH1870>: behold, thou art wroth <WH7107>; for we have sinned <WH2398>: in those is continuance <WH5769>, and we shall be saved <WH3467>.

But we are all as an unclean <WH2931> thing, and all our righteousnesses <WH6666> are as filthy <WH5708> rags <WH899>; and we all do fade <WH5034> <WH1101> as a leaf <WH5929>; and our iniquities <WH5771>, like the wind <WH7307>, have taken us away <WH5375>.

And there is none that calleth <WH7121> upon thy name <WH8034>, that stirreth up <WH5782> himself to take hold <WH2388> of thee: for thou hast hid <WH5641> thy face <WH6440> from us, and hast consumed <WH4127> us, because <WH3027> of our iniquities <WH5771>. consumed: Heb. melted because: Heb. by the hand
But now, O LORD <WH3068>, thou art our father <WH1>; we are the clay <WH2563>, and thou our potter <WH3335>; and we all are the work <WH4639> of thy hand <WH3027>.
Be not wroth <WH7107> very sore <WH3966>, O LORD <WH3068>, neither remember <WH2142> iniquity <WH5771> for ever <WH5703>: behold, see <WH5027>, we beseech thee, we are all thy people <WH5971>.
Thy holy <WH6944> cities <WH5892> are a wilderness <WH4057>, Zion <WH6726> is a wilderness <WH4057>, Jerusalem <WH3389> a desolation <WH8077>.

Our holy <WH6944> and our beautiful <WH8597> house <WH1004>, where our fathers <WH1> praised <WH1984> thee, is burned up <WH8316> with fire <WH784>: and all our pleasant things <WH4261> are laid waste <WH2723>.
Wilt thou refrain <WH662> thyself for these things, O LORD <WH3068>? wilt thou hold thy peace <WH2814>, and afflict <WH6031> us very sore <WH3966>?
